q: . Amitabh Srivastava , senior vice president over the company's Azure cloud unit, will be leaving, CEO Steve Ballmer said in an e-mail to employees Wednesday. Blade Network Technologies sells switches to improve blade server performance Windows Azure is in a great place, and Amitabh Srivastava is ready to move to a new phase in his career. He has done stellar work for the company and I will work to ensure a smooth transition with the Windows Azure team, said Steve Ballmer . It's thought that Amitabh Srivastava 's exit is connected to Microsoft's announcement that company veteran Satya Nadella would replace Bob Muglia as head of Server and Tools. Mr Stephen Elop said the world's biggest mobile operators were "all smiles" about the tie-up because Nokia has traditionally been more amiable to telecoms providers than Apple or Google. This is good news for operators, he said. "We are in a position to create a third ecosystem. We know what it means to be the most friendly to the operators."
